alert.note: Alert for Moses Lake Area; Northeast Mountains; Spokane Area; Upper Columbia Basin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Air Stagnation Advisory issued December 16 at 9:25AM PST until December 18 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... ...AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. For the Air Stagnation Advisory, stagnant conditions will have potential to trap pollutants near the ground with deteriorated air quality. * WHERE...Othello, Quincy, Metaline Falls, Metaline, Wilbur, Fairfield, Flowery Trail Road, Springdale-Hunters Road, Ephrata, Rockford, Grand Coulee, Kettle Falls, Northport, Spokane Valley, Deer Park, Ritzville, Ione, Fruitland, Coulee City, Newport, Tiger, Harrington, Cheney, Odessa, Colville, Moses Lake, Creston, Airway Heights, Chewelah, Orin-Rice Road, Downtown Spokane, and Davenport. * WHEN...For the Dense Fog Advisory, until noon PST today. For the Air Stagnation Advisory, until 10 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Low visibility could make driving conditions hazardous. Periods of air stagnation can lead to the buildup of pollutants near the surface.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you. Buildup of fine pollution particles can be harmful to those sensitive to air pollution including people with lung and heart problems, people with diabetes, children and the elderly.

area.areaDesc: Moses Lake Area; Northeast Mountains; Spokane Area; Upper Columbia Basin
